death_place.zh-cn: 燕京长春宫(今北京白云观)
death_place.en: Changchun Palace (present-day White Cloud Temple), Yanjing (present-day Beijing)

description.zh-cn: 金末元初全真道道士，为全真教第五任掌教。他因远赴西域劝谏成吉思汗“敬天爱民”、减少屠杀而闻名于世。他被奉为全真道“北七真”之一，以及龙门派的祖师。
description.en: A Taoist priest of the Quanzhen School during the late Jin and early Yuan dynasties, and the fifth leader of the Quanzhen School. He is renowned for traveling to the Western Regions to advise Genghis Khan to 'revere Heaven and love the people' and reduce slaughter. He is revered as one of the 'Seven True Disciples of the North' of the Quanzhen School and the founder of the Dragon Gate sect.

description.zh-cn: 全真道的创始人，丘处机的师父。
description.en: Founder of the Quanzhen School of Taoism and master of Qiu Chuji.

description.zh-cn: 由王重阳创立的道教主流派别之一。
description.en: One of the mainstream schools of Taoism, founded by Wang Chongyang.

description.zh-cn: 蒙古帝国的创始人和第一位大汗。他邀请丘处机西行会面，并采纳其部分建议。
description.en: The founder and first Great Khan of the Mongol Empire. He invited Qiu Chuji to meet him in the west and adopted some of his advice.

description.zh-cn: 丘处机的弟子，随其西行，后成为全真教第六任掌教。
description.en: A disciple of Qiu Chuji who accompanied him on his journey to the west and later became the sixth leader of the Quanzhen School.

description.zh-cn: 丘处机的弟子，随其西行，并撰写了《长春真人西游记》。
description.en: A disciple of Qiu Chuji who accompanied him on his journey to the west and wrote the 'Travels of the Perfect Man Changchun to the West'.

en: Seven True Disciples of the North

description.zh-cn: 全真教创始人王重阳的七位主要弟子。
description.en: The seven primary disciples of Wang Chongyang, founder of the Quanzhen School.

description.zh-cn: 全真教的主要支派之一，尊丘处机为祖师。
description.en: One of the main branches of the Quanzhen School, which reveres Qiu Chuji as its patriarch.

description.zh-cn: 金朝第五位皇帝，曾召见丘处机。
description.en: The fifth emperor of the Jin dynasty, who once summoned Qiu Chuji for an audience.

description.zh-cn: 金朝第六位皇帝，曾对丘处机及其道观予以支持。
description.en: The sixth emperor of the Jin dynasty, who supported Qiu Chuji and his Taoist temple.

description.zh-cn: 金朝第七位皇帝，曾召见丘处机。
description.en: The seventh emperor of the Jin dynasty, who once summoned Qiu Chuji for an audience.

description.zh-cn: 金朝第八位皇帝，曾因丘处机协助安抚民众而赐予封号。
description.en: The eighth emperor of the Jin dynasty, who bestowed a title upon Qiu Chuji for his assistance in pacifying the populace.

description.zh-cn: 南宋第四位皇帝，曾派人邀请丘处机但被拒绝。
description.en: The fourth emperor of the Southern Song dynasty, who sent envoys to invite Qiu Chuji but was declined.

description.zh-cn: 成吉思汗派遣的使者，负责邀请并护送丘处机西行。
description.en: An envoy sent by Genghis Khan, responsible for inviting and escorting Qiu Chuji on his journey west.

description.zh-cn: 元朝初年的重要政治家，奉成吉思汗之命记录其与丘处机的对话。
description.en: An important statesman in the early Yuan dynasty, who was ordered by Genghis Khan to record his conversations with Qiu Chuji.

en: Record of the Joyous Meeting of the Mysterious Wind

description.zh-cn: 由耶律楚材奉旨编录的，记录成吉思汗与丘处机对话的书籍。
description.en: A book compiled by Yelü Chucai under imperial edict, recording the dialogues between Genghis Khan and Qiu Chuji.

en: The Travels of the Perfect Man Changchun to the West

description.zh-cn: 由丘处机弟子李志常根据西行见闻所撰写的记述。
description.en: A record written by Qiu Chuji's disciple Li Zhichang based on his experiences during the journey to the west.

description.zh-cn: 元朝的创始皇帝，曾追赠丘处机封号。
description.en: The founding emperor of the Yuan dynasty, who posthumously granted a title to Qiu Chuji.

description.zh-cn: 元朝第三位皇帝，曾加封丘处机封号。
description.en: The third emperor of the Yuan dynasty, who granted an additional title to Qiu Chuji.

description.zh-cn: 全真教第四任掌教，丘处机的前任。
description.en: The fourth leader of the Quanzhen School, and Qiu Chuji's predecessor.

description.zh-cn: 金朝将领，曾请求丘处机协助安抚民众。
description.en: A general of the Jin dynasty who requested Qiu Chuji's assistance in pacifying the populace.

description.zh-cn: 位于北京的著名道观，原名天长观。1227年成吉思汗赐名长春宫，并由丘处机掌管。丘处机在此羽化。
description.en: A famous Taoist temple in Beijing, originally named Tianchang Guan. In 1227, Genghis Khan renamed it Changchun Palace and placed it under the authority of Qiu Chuji, who passed away there.

description.zh-cn: 1167年，丘处机拜全真道创始人王重阳为师。
description.en: In 1167, Qiu Chuji became a disciple of Wang Chongyang, the founder of the Quanzhen School.

description.zh-cn: 1203年，丘处机接替刘处玄成为全真道第五任掌教，直至1227年去世。
description.en: In 1203, Qiu Chuji succeeded Liu Chuxuan to become the fifth leader of the Quanzhen School, a position he held until his death in 1227.

description.zh-cn: 尹志平是丘处机的弟子，并随其西行会见成吉思汗。
description.en: Yin Zhiping was a disciple of Qiu Chuji and accompanied him on his journey west to meet Genghis Khan.

description.zh-cn: 李志常是丘处机的弟子，并随其西行会见成吉思汗。
description.en: Li Zhichang was a disciple of Qiu Chuji and accompanied him on his journey west to meet Genghis Khan.

description.zh-cn: 丘处机被奉为全真教龙门派的祖师。
description.en: Qiu Chuji is revered as the founder of the Dragon Gate sect of the Quanzhen School.

description.zh-cn: 丘处机是王重阳的七位主要弟子之一，合称“北七真”。
description.en: Qiu Chuji was one of Wang Chongyang's seven main disciples, collectively known as the 'Seven True Disciples of the North'.

description.zh-cn: 1222年，丘处机向成吉思汗阐述“敬天爱民”、减少屠杀、清心寡欲等治国养生之道，对其产生影响。
description.en: In 1222, Qiu Chuji expounded on the principles of 'revering Heaven and loving the people,' reducing slaughter, and practicing asceticism to Genghis Khan, influencing his approach to governance and personal cultivation.

description.zh-cn: 成吉思汗对丘处机极为敬重，下诏豁免全真道的赋役，并于1227年赐金虎牌，命其掌管天下道教事务。
description.en: Genghis Khan held Qiu Chuji in high esteem, issuing an edict to exempt the Quanzhen School from taxes and corvée labor, and in 1227, granted him a golden tiger tablet, appointing him to oversee all Taoist affairs in the empire.

description.zh-cn: 1188年春，丘处机应金世宗诏书邀请，前往燕京会面并主持万春节醮事。
description.en: In the spring of 1188, at the invitation of Emperor Shizong of Jin, Qiu Chuji traveled to Yanjing for an audience and to preside over the Wanchun Festival ceremonies.

description.zh-cn: 1207年，金章宗赐匾额及《玄都宝藏》予丘处机所在的栖霞太虚观，以示支持。
description.en: In 1207, Emperor Zhangzong of Jin showed his support by bestowing a plaque and the 'Xuan Du Bao Zang' scriptures upon the Taixu Temple in Qixia, where Qiu Chuji resided.

description.zh-cn: 1211年，丘处机奉金卫绍王诏书前往中都。
description.en: In 1211, Qiu Chuji traveled to the capital, Zhongdu, upon receiving an edict from the Prince of Wei Shao of Jin.

description.zh-cn: 1214年，因丘处机协助招抚山东起义民众，金宣宗朝廷赐其封号“自然应化弘教大师”。
description.en: In 1214, because Qiu Chuji assisted in pacifying rebels in Shandong, the court of Emperor Xuanzong of Jin bestowed upon him the title 'Master of Natural Response, Transformation, and Propagation of the Teachings'.

description.zh-cn: 1219年12月，作为成吉思汗的使者，刘仲禄到达山东莱州邀请丘处机，并随后陪同其西行。
description.en: In December 1219, as an envoy of Genghis Khan, Liu Zhonglu arrived in Laizhou, Shandong to invite Qiu Chuji, and subsequently accompanied him on his journey west.

description.zh-cn: 在西行途中，丘处机劝阻了刘仲禄为成吉思汗挑选处女的行为。
description.en: During the journey west, Qiu Chuji dissuaded Liu Zhonglu from the act of selecting virgins for Genghis Khan.

description.zh-cn: 李志常根据跟随丘处机西行的见闻，撰写了《长春真人西游记》一书。
description.en: Based on his experiences accompanying Qiu Chuji on his journey west, Li Zhichang wrote the book 'The Travels of the Perfect Man Changchun to the West'.

description.zh-cn: 成吉思汗下诏，命耶律楚材将他与丘处机的对话编集成《玄风庆会录》。
description.en: Genghis Khan ordered Yelü Chucai to compile his dialogues with Qiu Chuji into the 'Record of the Joyous Meeting of the Mysterious Wind'.

description.zh-cn: 1269年，元世祖忽必烈下诏追赠丘处机为“长春演道主教真人”的封号。
description.en: In 1269, Emperor Shizu of Yuan, Kublai Khan, issued an edict posthumously granting Qiu Chuji the title 'Perfect Man Changchun, Who Expounds the Tao and Leads the Religion'.

description.zh-cn: 元武宗加封丘处机为“长春全德神化明应真君”。
description.en: Emperor Wuzong of Yuan granted Qiu Chuji the additional title 'Perfect Lord Changchun of Complete Virtue, Divine Transformation, and Luminous Response'.

description.zh-cn: 1214年，金朝将领仆散安贞请求丘处机协助招抚山东地区的起义农民。
description.en: In 1214, the Jin dynasty general Pusan Anzhen requested Qiu Chuji's help in pacifying the peasant rebels in the Shandong region.

description.zh-cn: 1227年，成吉思汗下圣旨，将天长观改名为长春宫（今白云观），并赐予丘处机。
description.en: In 1227, Genghis Khan issued an edict renaming the Tianchang Temple to Changchun Palace (present-day White Cloud Temple) and bestowing it upon Qiu Chuji.
